ovdesc.p: This application allows a user to select a particular portfolio or a group of portfolios from a criteria or several criteria and compare the holdings of a portfolio against the strategy contained in the investment program.

- Select of portfolios to process, these selection process can either select the portfolio ID's desired or by selecting fields from the portfolio file (SAM) a selection of portfolios can be made based on the selected criteria and values chosen.

- Optional possibility to force the comparison engine to compare a portfolio or consolidate portfolio to any selected Matrix. Note orders cannot be generated when forcing a comparison, they can only be generated based on the Investment Program linked to a portfolio (or to be precise to the matrix linked to this investment program.)
- Instructions buttons (flag Yes/No) to execute a selected process on each portfolio such as Compare, Rebalance, Edit .
- The ability to display the results of the comparison via context sensitive drilldown enquiries.
When a record is commited with the START flag set to yes a request is placed to process a bulk rebalancing by the AM.SC.MOVEMENT service.
This application shares is layout with AM.COMPARE.DETAILS therefore some fields are not update in this applicaiton but are in AM.COMAPARE.DETAILS

desc.p: RBL.ROUND.BUY
Specifies rounding rules to calculate the nominal of BUY orders, generated through rebalancing.
Automatically defaults the values from RBL.ROUND.BUY field of AM.PARAMETER.
Validation Rules:

p.p: Accepts any one of the following values ‘UP’ or ‘DOWN’ or ‘CLOSER’
UP: The nominal is rounded to the closest round lot above the target.
DOWN: The nominal is rounded to the closest round lot below the target.
CLOSER: The nominal is rounded up or down to the closest rounding lot depending on whichever is closer to the target.
If the value of RBL.ROUND.BUY in AM.PARAMETER is null then Rebalancing will consider the value given in ROUNDING.TYPE of AM.COMPARE or ROUNDING.TYPE of AM.PARAMETER
